definition: Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Michelangelo, who based much of his art on the nude figure, here revels in massed drapery.
sentences.chinese: 這是我對米開朗基羅這付作品的美藝說明。

sentences.english: Because of these interruptions, Michelangelo worked on the tomb for 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 由於這些中斷，米開朗基羅在墳塋工作了40年。

sentences.english: And the image is much more specifically of Michelangelo's Pieta.
sentences.chinese: 這一幕像極了米開朗基羅的聖母哀子像。

sentences.english: Michaelangelo is the master of the whirling nunchakus.
sentences.chinese: 米開朗基羅是耍雙節棍的高手。

sentences.english: The Sistine Chapel ceiling painted by Michelangelo.
sentences.chinese: 西斯廷教堂的棚頂的繪畫由米開朗基羅繪製。

sentences.english: He was just trying to paint well; he couldn't help painting like Michelangelo.
sentences.chinese: 他只是想畫好，他無法畫得不像米開朗基羅。

definition: Taiwan equivalent of 莫奈[Mo4 nai4]
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
